title: BRIEF-Spirit Aerosystems Holdings Q1 Revenue Rose 30% To $1.2 Billion
text:
* Q1 ADJUSTED EARNINGS PER SHARE $0.03

* Q1 LOSS PER SHARE $0.51

* Q1 REVENUE ROSE 30 PERCENT TO $1.2 BILLION

* Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $-0.56, REVENUE VIEW $1.09 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA

* SPIRIT AEROSYSTEMS - RECOVERY CONTINUES DESPITE ONGOING CHALLENGES FROM COVID-19 PANDEMIC, RUSSIA/UKRAINE CONFLICT, SUPPLY CHAIN DISRUPTIONS, INFLATION

* FREE CASH FLOW USAGE IN QUARTER OF $298 MILLION, REFLECTING Q1 HEADWINDS AS WELL AS IMPACTS OF RUSSIA/UKRAINE CONFLICTS

* SPIRIT AEROSYSTEMS - ON 737 MAX, RECENTLY INCREASED PRODUCTION TO 31 SHIPSETS PER MONTH, CURRENTLY EXPECT TO HOLD AT THAT RATE FOR REMAINDER OF YEAR

* CONTINUE TO WORK WITH BOEING, AIRBUS AND OUR OTHER CUSTOMERS ON PRODUCTION RATE SCENARIOS Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
